text:
In this video, you’ll see how to set up fine-
grained permissions for AWS Marketplace sellers.

With this capability, AWS Marketplace 
sellers can precisely control access to

the various sections within the AWS 
Marketplace Management Portal.

By incorporating fine-grained 
 permissions into policies,

sellers can better ensure users only see and 
act on information according to their role.

AWS Marketplace is phasing out two legacy 
permissions: uploadFiles and viewSettings.

The deprecated permissions have 
been replaced with 17 new ones.

This sample policy incorporates the new
 permissions required to grant access to

view the seller account settings in the 
AWS Marketplace Management Portal.

Let’s navigate to the portal 
and view the Settings page.

This role can view basic information, but it 
doesn’t have permissions to view the other tabs.

Next, let’s see how each of these 
functional roles can be set up with

its own IAM policy to enforce precise 
access control over sensitive information.

This sample policy for bank officers 
grants permissions to manage payment

information in the AWS 
Marketplace Management Portal.

Let’s open the console as a bank officer 
and update the banking information.

We have access to the banking 
information but are restricted from
viewing the tax information.

Likewise, we are restricted from 
viewing information on the other tabs.
This is an IAM policy for tax officers.
From the Payment information tab,

tax officers can go to the tax 
dashboard to input the required data.

This dashboard was restricted 
from view by bank officers.

This IAM policy grants permissions to a 
Know Your Customer (KYC) compliance
officer to complete the KYC compliance form.

As a KYC compliance officer, we can 
access the Know your customer tab and

update the KYC compliance 
requirements specific to our region.

We can utilize other permissions in our IAM 
policies to manage access for secondary KYC users,

AWS Marketplace email contacts, 
pending tasks, and support tickets.

You’ve just seen how to set up fine-grained 
permissions for AWS Marketplace sellers.

You can learn more about this topic in 
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it’s your turn to try.
